title: Relates to the definition of employment as it concerns professional models; repealer
summary: Relates to the definition of employment as it concerns professional models and the individuals or entities which engage them; defines under what circumstances a model would be considered an independent contractor.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1852

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 12, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. WRIGHT -- read once and referred to the Committee
         on Labor

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the  labor law and the workers' compensation law, in
         relation to the definition of employment as it  concerns  professional
         models  and  the  individuals  and  entities which engage them; and to
         repeal certain provisions of the labor law and  the  workers'  compen-
         sation law relating thereto

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subparagraph 3 of paragraph (b) of subdivision 1 of section
    2  511 of the labor law is REPEALED.
    3    S 2. Subdivision 1 of section 511 of  the  labor  law  is  amended  by
    4  adding a new paragraph (c) to read as follows:
    5    (C)  THE  TERM "EMPLOYMENT" DOES NOT INCLUDE THE SERVICES OF A PROFES-
    6  SIONAL MODEL NOR IS A MODEL MANAGER, ADVERTISER, PERSON, CORPORATION  OR
    7  OTHER  ENTITY  AN "EMPLOYER" OF A PROFESSIONAL MODEL FOR THE PURPOSES OF
    8  THIS ARTICLE, WHERE THE PROFESSIONAL MODEL MEETS ALL  OF  THE  FOLLOWING
    9  CRITERIA:
   10    (1) HAS THE RIGHT TO NEGOTIATE HIS OR HER RATE OF COMPENSATION AND THE
   11  BASIS FOR REIMBURSEMENT FOR EXPENSES;
   12    (2)  HAS  THE RIGHT TO ACCEPT OR REJECT JOB ASSIGNMENTS, HOURS OF WORK
   13  AND PERFORMANCE LOCATIONS;
   14    (3) HAS THE RIGHT TO PERFORM SERVICES FOR OTHER  ADVERTISERS,  PERSONS
   15  OR ENTITIES;
   16    (4) INCURS HIS OR HER OWN EXPENSES, INCLUDING EXPENSES FOR PORTFOLIOS;
   17    (5)  BEARS  HIS  OR  HER OWN RISK OF LOSS IF A CLIENT FAILS TO PAY ITS
   18  BILL; AND
   19    (6) RECEIVES NO FRINGE BENEFITS.
   20    AS USED IN THIS PARAGRAPH, (I) "PROFESSIONAL  MODEL"  MEANS  A  PERSON
   21  WHO,  IN  THE  COURSE  OF  HIS  OR  HER TRADE, OCCUPATION OR PROFESSION,
   22  PERFORMS MODELING SERVICES;

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD05650-01-1

       A. 1852                             2

    1    (II) "MODELING SERVICES" MEANS THE APPEARANCE BY A PROFESSIONAL  MODEL
    2  IN PHOTOGRAPHIC SESSIONS OR THE ENGAGEMENT OF SUCH MODEL IN LIVE, FILMED
    3  OR TAPED MODELING PERFORMANCES FOR REMUNERATION;
    4    (III)  "MODEL  MANAGER"  MEANS  A  PERSON  OR  ENTITY WHICH REPRESENTS
    5  PROFESSIONAL MODELS WITH RESPECT TO THEIR MODELING CAREERS.
    6    S 3. The fifth undesignated paragraph of subdivision 4 of section 2 of
    7  the workers' compensation law is REPEALED.
    8    S 4. Section 2 of the workers' compensation law is amended by adding a
    9  new subdivision 4-a to read as follows:
   10    4-A. THE TERM "EMPLOYEE" DOES NOT INCLUDE THE SERVICES  OF  A  PROFES-
   11  SIONAL  MODEL NOR IS A MODEL MANAGER, ADVERTISER, PERSON, CORPORATION OR
   12  OTHER ENTITY AN "EMPLOYER" OF A PROFESSIONAL MODEL FOR THE  PURPOSES  OF
   13  THIS  ARTICLE,  WHERE  THE PROFESSIONAL MODEL MEETS ALL OF THE FOLLOWING
   14  CRITERIA:
   15    (A) HAS THE RIGHT TO NEGOTIATE HIS OR HER RATE OF COMPENSATION AND THE
   16  BASIS FOR REIMBURSEMENT FOR EXPENSES;
   17    (B) HAS THE RIGHT TO ACCEPT OR REJECT JOB ASSIGNMENTS, HOURS  OF  WORK
   18  AND PERFORMANCE LOCATIONS;
   19    (C)  HAS  THE RIGHT TO PERFORM SERVICES FOR OTHER ADVERTISERS, PERSONS
   20  OR ENTITIES;
   21    (D) INCURS HIS OR HER OWN EXPENSES, INCLUDING EXPENSES FOR PORTFOLIOS;
   22    (E) BEARS HIS OR HER OWN RISK OF LOSS IF A CLIENT  FAILS  TO  PAY  ITS
   23  BILL; AND
   24    (F) RECEIVES NO FRINGE BENEFITS.
   25    AS  USED IN THIS SECTION, (I) "PROFESSIONAL MODEL" MEANS A PERSON WHO,
   26  IN THE COURSE OF HIS OR HER TRADE, OCCUPATION  OR  PROFESSION,  PERFORMS
   27  MODELING SERVICES;
   28    (II)  "MODELING SERVICES" MEANS THE APPEARANCE BY A PROFESSIONAL MODEL
   29  IN PHOTOGRAPHIC SESSIONS OR THE ENGAGEMENT OF SUCH MODEL IN LIVE, FILMED
   30  OR TAPED MODELING PERFORMANCES FOR REMUNERATION;
   31    (III) "MODEL MANAGER"  MEANS  A  PERSON  OR  ENTITY  WHICH  REPRESENTS
   32  PROFESSIONAL MODELS WITH RESPECT TO THEIR MODELING CAREERS.
   33    S  5.  The  closing  paragraph  of subdivision 5 of section 201 of the
   34  workers' compensation law is REPEALED.
   35    S 6. Section 201 of the workers' compensation law is amended by adding
   36  a new subdivision 5-a to read as follows:
   37    5-A. THE TERM "EMPLOYEE" DOES NOT INCLUDE THE SERVICES  OF  A  PROFES-
   38  SIONAL  MODEL NOR IS A MODEL MANAGER, ADVERTISER, PERSON, CORPORATION OR
   39  OTHER ENTITY AN "EMPLOYER" OF A PROFESSIONAL MODEL FOR THE  PURPOSES  OF
   40  THIS  ARTICLE,  WHERE  THE PROFESSIONAL MODEL MEETS ALL OF THE FOLLOWING
   41  CRITERIA:
   42    (A) HAS THE RIGHT TO NEGOTIATE HIS OR HER RATE OF COMPENSATION AND THE
   43  BASIS FOR REIMBURSEMENT FOR EXPENSES;
   44    (B) HAS THE RIGHT TO ACCEPT OR REJECT JOB ASSIGNMENTS, HOURS  OF  WORK
   45  AND PERFORMANCE LOCATIONS;
   46    (C)  HAS  THE RIGHT TO PERFORM SERVICES FOR OTHER ADVERTISERS, PERSONS
   47  OR ENTITIES;
   48    (D) INCURS HIS OR HER OWN EXPENSES, INCLUDING EXPENSES FOR PORTFOLIOS;
   49    (E) BEARS HIS OR HER OWN RISK OF LOSS IF A CLIENT  FAILS  TO  PAY  ITS
   50  BILL; AND
   51    (F) RECEIVES NO FRINGE BENEFITS.
   52    AS  USED IN THIS SECTION, (I) "PROFESSIONAL MODEL" MEANS A PERSON WHO,
   53  IN THE COURSE OF HIS OR HER TRADE, OCCUPATION  OR  PROFESSION,  PERFORMS
   54  MODELING SERVICES;

       A. 1852                             3

    1    (II)  "MODELING SERVICES" MEANS THE APPEARANCE BY A PROFESSIONAL MODEL
    2  IN PHOTOGRAPHIC SESSIONS OR THE ENGAGEMENT OF SUCH MODEL IN LIVE, FILMED
    3  OR TAPED MODELING PERFORMANCES FOR REMUNERATION;
    4    (III)  "MODEL  MANAGER"  MEANS  A  PERSON  OR  ENTITY WHICH REPRESENTS
    5  PROFESSIONAL MODELS WITH RESPECT TO THEIR MODELING CAREERS.
    6    S 7. This act shall take effect immediately.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the labor law and the workers' compensation law, in relation to the definition of employment as it concerns professional models and the individuals and entities which engage them; and to repeal certain provisions of the labor law and the workers' compensation law relating thereto
